2D0210574EDF47199CFC99436B988FCB.description: explores essential skills, knowledge and attitudes required for effective participation in the global workplace and marketplace

255E681D802949D59C14ADAC3D9F7147.description: appreciates the contributions of different individuals and groups to the community

46B9399DD90C4F38BB55B616E1CA82DD.description: examines similarities that exist among cultures in Canadian society; examine cultural similarities in the school and community; and reflect on the impact of this on self, school and community

CF1CA45CC2D240429CF0CAC90FA5DB9A.description: examines diversity in the school and community; and reflect on its impact on self, school and community

6C5818C568054F9F9B3A6BA4C90EE4F2.description: 7 Will explore, understand, appreciate and value Ukrainian culture in Canada and the world for personal growth, enrichment and satisfaction, and for participating in and contributing to an interdependent and multicultural global society.

B828E2E27A2047D994AD0821549A30DA.description: selects and uses a variety of social and affective strategies to enhance general learning; e.g., take part in group problem-solving processes

B31978FD04F34A25BBB667EEB59F7AFC.description: selects and uses a variety of productive strategies; e.g., take notes when reading or listening to assist in producing their own text

1560EBA3CA5A4BA9A8ACE06731A1D0F2.description: selects and uses a variety of interactive strategies; e.g., uses a range of fillers, hesitation devices and gambits to sustain conversations, uses circumlocution to compensate for lack of vocabulary

8D5B7D09A06F45FBBAA66974FEA1D9B9.description: selects and uses a variety of metacognitive strategies to enhance language learning; e.g., experience various methods of language acquisition and identify one or more that are particularly usesful personally
